intro: Tepion alatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features trifoliate leaves with broad, ovate leaflets and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its root system is known for containing alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Tepion alatum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
